page.title: 15HOME LIFE/SAFETY/PETS.
page.content: Many residents in this area take the precaution of fitting a burglar alarm to their property because they are more vulnerable being in a lonely part of the countryside, with no street- lighting. Double-glazing and special locks on the doors are other safety measures taken by householders in the busier part,closer to{Headcorn village DOGS are the most popular pets, though some are working farm dogs. There are Dpg training classes held in the village,which many owners take advan- tage of. HORSES are kept for riding by people with private stabling.The local farms have a number pets as well as their stock animals - GOATS, DONKEYS, and of course CATS to catch any vermin CATS are also popular pets with the non-farming comunity, as are caged birds like budgerigars.
